required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Role of Transrectal-ultrasound in Evaluation of Azoospermia
clinical_study.official_title: Role of Transrectal-ultrasound in Evaluation of Azoospermia

brief_summary.textblock: Azoospermia is a word meaning to ejaculates with no spermatozoa without a definite underlying cause .1% of men has azoospermia, representing nearly 10 to 15% of all infertile men. The azoospermia is a major concern in our community. There is no actual epidemiological studies to estimate the actual numbers in Egypt. Azoospermia has several classifications, pre-testicular, testicular & post-testicular cause .The semen analysis is the main investigation done for these patient .The treatment methods range from hormonal therapy to surgery or ICSI . The imaging modalities has developed greatly in the last 3 decades. That it became in several setting as a bedside test or investigation. The main modalities used in azoospermia are scrotal ultrasound, TRUS and MRI. The first TRUS was introduced 1957.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients With obstructive azoospermia
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion ,within average one year.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patient with non obstructive azoospermia
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion , within average one year.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patient that will respond to endoscopic treatment
Number of patients that will need sperm extraction

intervention.description: we perform trus to identify the cause of azospermia and its type either obstructive or not

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- • Adult patients with azoospermia as identified by semen analysis.
- Age from 18 years to more
Exclusion Criteria:
- • History of operative intervention in the lower urinary tract.

reference.citation: Aziz N. The importance of semen analysis in the context of azoospermia. Clinics (Sao Paulo). 2013;68 Suppl 1:35-8. Review.
Gudeloglu A, Parekattil SJ. Update in the evaluation of the azoospermic male. Clinics (Sao Paulo). 2013;68 Suppl 1:27-34. Review.
Cocuzza M, Alvarenga C, Pagani R. The epidemiology and etiology of azoospermia. Clinics (Sao Paulo). 2013;68 Suppl 1:15-26. Review.

Sihag P, Tandon A, Pal R, Jain BK, Bhatt S, Kaur S, Sinha A. Sonography in male infertility: a look beyond the obvious. J Ultrasound. 2018 Sep;21(3):265-276. doi: 10.1007/s40477-018-0294-5. Epub 2018 Mar 28. Review.
